cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 40 miles ESE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest along Florida’s east coast today, then curving north-northwest to north and accelerating toward the coasts of Georgia and the Carolinas Monday-Tuesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just offshore the east-central Florida coast (around the Space Coast area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge watch: Jupiter Inlet FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL and Edisto Beach SC to Cape Fear NC.  Tropical-storm watch: North of South Santee River SC to Surf City NC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning: Hallandale Beach FL to South Santee River SC (all on Atlantic side) and Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Atlantic side of Florida and the entire southeast U.S. coastline northward into the Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Brief outer rainbands could produce gusts 20–30 mph, sustained winds generally below gale force
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Gulf (Tampa) side
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible from outer bands
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increased rip-current risk in the Gulf may occur but no major operational hazards expected
